title: Cecil Perkins
text:
Cecil Boyce Perkins (December 1, 1940 – October 28, 2021) was an American <a href="Major%20League%20Baseball">Major League Baseball</a> <a href="pitcher">pitcher</a> who appeared in two <a href="games%20pitched">games</a> for the <a href="New%20York%20Yankees">New York Yankees</a> in . He posted a 0–1 <a href="win-loss%20record%20%28pitching%29">record</a> with a 9.00 <a href="earned%20run%20average">earned run average</a> in five full <a href="innings%20pitched">innings pitched</a>. His <a href="professional%20baseball">professional baseball</a> career lasted seven years (1962–1968), all in the Yankee organization.
Perkins batted and threw right-handed, stood tall and weighed . The <a href="Baltimore">Baltimore</a> native attended <a href="Salem%20University">Salem University</a> and <a href="Shepherd%20University">Shepherd University</a>, both in <a href="West%20Virginia">West Virginia</a>. He appeared in 116 games in the <a href="minor%20leagues">minor leagues</a>, 102 as a <a href="starting%20pitcher">starting pitcher</a>. His <a href="MLB">MLB</a> trial occurred in July 1967. In his debut, July 5 against the contending <a href="Minnesota%20Twins">Minnesota Twins</a>, he started against <a href="Jim%20Kaat">Jim Kaat</a>, surrendered five <a href="hit%20%28baseball%29">hits</a> and five <a href="earned%20run">earned run</a>s in three innings, and was charged with the eventual 10–4 defeat. Three days later, against the <a href="Baltimore%20Orioles">Baltimore Orioles</a>, he threw two scoreless innings of <a href="relief%20pitcher">relief</a> to lower his career ERA to 9.00. He surrendered six total hits (including a <a href="home%20run">home run</a> to <a href="Rich%20Reese">Rich Reese</a>) and two <a href="bases%20on%20balls">bases on balls</a> in the majors, with one <a href="strikeout">strikeout</a>.
